anxious.text: Try: "I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed right now. Can we pause and come back to this in a few minutes?"
Try: "I'm getting anxious about this conversation. Can we take a moment to breathe together?"
Try: "I'm feeling a bit shaky. Can we agree to take a short break and check in with each other?"
Try: "I'm worried I'm not hearing you clearly. Can we slow down and clarify our points?"
Try: "I can feel my anxiety rising. Would it help if we took a quick walk or stretch?"
Try: "My heart's racing—I'd like to take three deep breaths together before we continue."
Try: "I care about what you're saying, but I need a moment to calm down. Let's pick this up shortly."
Try: "I'm feeling a bit panicky. Can we agree to pause and come back to this later?"
Try: "I'm feeling overwhelmed by my emotions. Can we take a step back and talk about this calmly?"
Try: "I'm feeling a bit lost in this conversation. Can we take a moment to regroup?"

avoidant.text: Try: "I need a moment to collect my thoughts. Can we pause and come back to this?"
Try: "I'm feeling a bit overwhelmed right now. Can we take a short break?"
Try: "I need some space to process this. Can we revisit it in a little while?"
Try: "I'm not sure how to respond right now. Can we take a breather?"
Try: "I'm feeling a bit anxious about this conversation. Can we slow down for a moment?"
Try: "I think I need five minutes to clear my head—let's pick up after that."
Try: "My mind feels scattered—would stepping away briefly help me respond more clearly?"
Try: "I need to step back for a moment to think—can we set a time to reconnect?"
Try: "I'm finding this intense—could we pause here and reconvene in 10 minutes?"
Try: "I'm feeling overloaded—would a quick break help me come back more present?"
Try: "I need a little alone time to sort my thoughts—thank you for your patience."
Try: "I'm feeling emotionally full—can we pause and I'll check back soon?"
Try: "I'd like a moment to breathe—can we circle back when I've had a chance to reset?"
Try: "I'm noticing I'm pulling away—could we agree on a short pause and then resume?"
Try: "I care about this talk, but I need a moment alone—let's reconnect shortly."

disorganized.text: Try: "This is bringing up a lot for me. Can we slow down and talk about one thing at a time?"
Try: "I'm feeling overwhelmed by everything right now. Can we take a step back?"
Try: "My thoughts are all over the place—can we focus on one point at a time?"
Try: "I'm feeling scattered—can we take a moment to breathe and refocus?"
Try: "I'm having trouble keeping up with everything—can we simplify this discussion?"
Try: "I feel like I'm jumping around—could you help me by asking one question at a time?"
Try: "My mind is racing—can we write down the main points and tackle them one by one?"
Try: "I'm getting lost—would it help if we paused for a moment and re‑centered?"
Try: "I'm confused by too many details—can we agree on the top three issues to address?"
Try: "I keep spinning thoughts—could we take two minutes of silence to collect ourselves?"
Try: "I feel pulled in different directions—can we pick one topic and stick with it?"
Try: "My brain feels flooded—would a brief walk or stretch help us regroup?"
Try: "I'm struggling to articulate this—would it help if I jotted down my concerns first?"
Try: "I'm scattered—can we set a clear next step before moving on?"
Try: "I'm overwhelmed by options—could we list the pros and cons together?"

secure.text: Try: "I'm worried this is going sideways. Can we each share one thing we appreciate before proceeding?"
Try: "I notice my voice is shaking. Would it help if we slowed our pace?"
Try: "I'm getting lost in my thoughts—can we break for two minutes so I can gather myself?"
Try: "I'm afraid I'm misunderstanding you—could you say that one more time gently?"
Try: "I'm feeling a knot in my stomach—can we take a quick stretch or sip of water?"
Try: "I want to be present but my mind is racing—can we agree on a short breath break?"
Try: "I care so much that I'm panicking—can we name one concrete thing we agree on first?"
Try: "My anxiety is spiking—can I text you an emoji when I need a moment to regroup?"
Try: "I'm feeling insecure about where this is going—could we check in on each other's needs?"
Try: "I realize I'm spiraling—can I jot down my main worry and share it with you?"
Try: "I'm crumbling a bit—would it help if we paused for five deep breaths together?"
Try: "I need a mini break to feel safe—can we return in two minutes?"
Try: "My thoughts are fluttering—can we each take one turn to speak and then pause?"
